name: strontium carbonate production | strontium carbonate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14325/documentation

This dataset represents the production of strontium carbonate from strontium sulfate (celestite ore) via the black ash process.;The unreacted reactants are considered to be flushed out with the reaction wastewater. Sodium sulfide is formed as a by-product.;Celestite is mined mainly in Spain, China and Mexico.;Strontium carbonate is used in the manufacturing of ceramics and glass products (e.g. cathode ray tubes, X-ray absorbing glass, as a flux). Additionally, it is used in electronic applications (e.g. manufacturing of color television receivers), pyrotechnics and fireworks as a colorant.;In the black ash process, celestite concentrate is mixed with coke at 1100 °C to form stronitum sulfide and carbon dioxide. The strontium sulfide is further reacted with soda ash to collect the precipitated strontium carbonate:;SrSO4 + 2 C --> SrS + 2 CO2;SrS + Na2CO3 --> SrCO3 + Na2S;References:;Nuss P., Eckelmann M. J. (2014): Life Cycle Assessment of Metals: A Scientific Synthesis, PLoS ONE 9 (7);Gendorf (2020). Umwelterklärung 2019, Umwelterklärung 2017, Werk Gendorf Industriepark, www.gendorf.de.

This activity starts with the delivery of material and energy inputs on site.

This activity ends with the production of strontium carbonate. This datasets includes the consumption of raw materials and energy, the use of infrastructure and direct emissions to the environment.
The dataset:  heat production, at coal coke industrial furnace 1-10MW, GLO, version 3.7.1., was used as a proxy for coke.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Arbitrary time period chosen for the proxy.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Commercial strontium carbonate is produced via the black ash process. In a first step, celestite concentrate (SrSO4) is mixed with ground coke at 1100 °C, The formed strontium sulfide is reacted with sodium carbonate in water, whereas strontium carbonate precipitates. A yield of 80% is assumed.;SrSO4 (MW 183.68) + 2 C (12.01) --> SrS (MW 119.69) + 2 CO2 (MW 44.01);SrS (MW 119.69) + Na2CO3 (MW 105.99) --> SrCO3 (MW 147.63) + Na2S (MW 79.06);The dataset heat production, at coal coke industrial furnace 1-10MW, GLO, version 3.7.1. was used as a proxy for coke consumption.;References:;Nuss P., Eckelmann M. J. (2014): Life Cycle Assessment of Metals: A Scientific Synthesis, PLoS ONE 9 (7);Gendorf (2020). Umwelterklärung 2019, Umwelterklärung 2017, Werk Gendorf Industriepark, www.gendorf.de.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation and 80% yield assumption. Energy consumptions are modelled with data from literature. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructures are calculated with standard values.
To represent the coke use, the dataset: heat production, at coal coke industrial furnace 1-10MW, GLO, version 3.7.1., with all emissions was included.
References:
Nuss P., Eckelmann M. J. (2014): Life Cycle Assessment of Metals: A Scientific Synthesis, PLoS ONE 9 (7)
Gendorf (2020). Umwelterklärung 2019, Umwelterklärung 2017, Werk Gendorf Industriepark, www.gendorf.de.

exchanges.description: Formula: SrCO3

flow.name: Scandium
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. This value is a 5-year average of data (2015 - 2019) published by the Gendorf factory (Gendorf, 2016, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2017, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of heat used per kg of chemical substance produced is calculated using literature data published by the Gendorf factory based in Germany, which produces a wide range of chemical substances. The factory produced 1634200 tonnes of chemical substances in the year 2019 (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) and 870000 tonnes of intermediate products. The amount of heat in the year 2019 was 5101290 GJ (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) of which 90% was obtained from natural gas and 10% from steam. The resulting amount of heat from steam is 0.27 MJ/kg of chemical product produced. The 5-year average (2015 - 2019, weighted by production volume) is 0.21 MJ/kg. Cross-reference: the amount of chemicals produced (excluding intermediate products) in the EU-28 in the year 2017 was 291 million tonnes (Eurostat, http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Chemicals_production_statistics, accessed 2021-01-21). The  energy (both heat and electricity) consumed per kg of chemicals produced in 2017 is 7.58 MJ/kg. This is higher than the value calculated using data published by Gendorf – 3.53 MJ/kg, but that is to be expected as the intermediate products are not accounted for.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. This value is a 5-year average of data (2015 - 2019) published by the Gendorf factory (Gendorf, 2016, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2017, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of wastewater (which is later on treated in the municipal WWTP) per kg of chemical substance produced is calculated using literature data published by the Gendorf factory based in Germany, which produces a wide range of chemical substances. The factory produced 1634200 tonnes of chemical substances in the year 2019 (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) and 870000 tonnes of intermediate products. The amount of wastewater which is later on treated in the municipal WWTP in the year 2019 was 6821 tonnes (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The resulting amount of wastewater is 2.3E-06 m3/kg of chemical product produced.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. This value is a 5-year average of data (2015 - 2019) published by the Gendorf factory (Gendorf, 2016, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2017, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of water for cooling extracted per kg of chemical substance produced is calculated using literature data published by the Gendorf factory based in Germany, which produces a wide range of chemical substances. The reported amounts of water extracted as groundwater and surface water (river) are assumed to be used entirely for cooling purposes.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Emission from dataset 'coal coke industrial furnace 1-10MW, GLO, version 3.7.1' to represent coke use.Mass balance. Represents the amount of process and cooling water that is emitted back to watershed in  the first reaction step.
In the second step:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of water released back to the environment consists of the amount of process water treated in the internal WWTP and then released back to the environment and the amount of cooling water released back to the environment.

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Emission from dataset 'coal coke industrial furnace 1-10MW, GLO, version 3.7.1' to represent coke use.Represents the amount of process and cooling water that is evaporated in the first reaction step.
For the second step:
Calculated to ensure the water balance. In general, in the case of recirculating cooling systems, 77% of the water input evaporates to air. In case of once-through cooling systems, 4% of the water input evaporates to air. The process water has in the chemical industry an average evaporation rate of 20.5%. In the specific case of the Gendorf factory, the calculated evaporation rate based on the data published is 6.3%. This matches the qualitative information, that the majority of the cooling systems in Gendorf are once-through and that the amount of cooling water used is significantly higher than the amount of process water used (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de).

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. This value is a 5-year average of data (2015 - 2019) published by the Gendorf factory (Gendorf, 2016, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2017, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of wastewater (which is later on treated in the municipal WWTP) per kg of chemical substance produced is calculated using literature data published by the Gendorf factory based in Germany, which produces a wide range of chemical substances. The factory produced 1634200 tonnes of chemical substances in the year 2019 (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) and 870000 tonnes of intermediate products. The amount of wastewater which is later on treated in the municipal WWTP in the year 2019 was 6821 tonnes (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The resulting amount of wastewater is 2.3E-06 m3/kg of chemical product produced.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. This value is a 5-year average of data (2015 - 2019) published by the Gendorf factory (Gendorf, 2016, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2017, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of electricity per kg of chemical substance produced is calculated using literature data published by the Gendorf factory based in Germany, which produces a wide range of chemical substances. The factory produced 1634200 tonnes of chemical substances in the year 2019 (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) and 870000 tonnes of intermediate products. The amount of electricity consumed in the year 2019 was 3381300 GJ (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The resulting amount of electricity is 0.375 kWh/kg (year 2019) of chemical substance produced. The 5-year average (2015 - 2019, weighted by production volume) is 0.3991 kWh/kg (1.44 MJ/kg). Cross-reference: the amount of chemicals produced (excluding intermediate products) in the EU-28 in the year 2017 was 291 million tonnes (Eurostat, http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Chemicals_production_statistics, accessed 2021-01-21). The  energy (both heat and electricity) consumed per kg of chemicals produced in 2017 is 7.58 MJ/kg. This is higher than the value calculated using data published by Gendorf – 3.53 MJ/kg, but that is to be expected as the intermediate products are not accounted for.

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. This value is a 5-year average of data (2015 - 2019) published by the Gendorf factory (Gendorf, 2016, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2017, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de),  (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de). The amount of heat used per kg of chemical substance produced is calculated using literature data published by the Gendorf factory based in Germany, which produces a wide range of chemical substances. The factory produced 1634200 tonnes of chemical substances in the year 2019 (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) and 870000 tonnes of intermediate products. The amount of heat in the year 2019 was 5101290 GJ (Gendorf, 2020, Umwelterklärung, www.gendorf.de) of which 90% was obtained from natural gas and 10% from steam. The resulting amount of heat from natural gas is 1.77 MJ/kg of chemical product produced. The 5-year average (2015 - 2019, weighted by production volume) is 1.89 MJ/kg. Cross-reference: the amount of chemicals produced (excluding intermediate products) in the EU-28 in the year 2017 was 291 million tonnes (Eurostat, http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Chemicals_production_statistics, accessed 2021-01-21). The  energy (both heat and electricity) consumed per kg of chemicals produced in 2017 is 7.58 MJ/kg. This is higher than the value calculated using data published by Gendorf – 3.53 MJ/kg, but that is to be expected as the intermediate products are not accounted for.
